docs.lead_paragraph: The Lindsay administration plans to press the 1972 State Legislature for enactment of a tough law curbing the fast-rising cost of hospital care.

headline.main: Lindsay Seeks Curb on Hospital Costs

docs.abstract: NYC's health legis to include 2 bills affecting pharmacies, to authorize pharmacists to substitute generic equivilants when physicians prescribe more expensive trade-name drugs and to repeal law that prohibits pharmacists from advertising prices of prescription drugs in effort to ease comparative shopping
docs.snippet: The Lindsay administration plans to press the 1972 State Legislature for enactment of a tough law curbing the fast-rising cost of hospital care.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 -- Cocaine Lil, whose ballad hasn't been heard much during the last 40 years, seems to be making a comeback.

headline.main: Cocaine Is Re-emerging as a Major Problem, While Marijuana Remains Popular

docs.abstract: US Custom officials disclose that according to '71 figures on drug seizures, cocaine is re-emerging as major drug problem in US, while marijuana, LSD and heroin are basically remaining at same level; statistics; graph of cocaine seizures '69-'71
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 -- Cocaine Lil, whose ballad hasn't been heard much during the last 40 years, seems to be making a comeback.

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK JR.Special to The New York Times
